## Import data

```{r, eval=F}
workbook_path = "./data/testdata/GuyanaARTWorkbookMC_thru2022_April2024_copy.xlsx"
data = readxl::read_excel(workbook_path, "CarbonStocks")
data
```

## Replicate SimVoi

We utilize the replicate function to execute the simulation multiple times with `replicate(n=10000`, while determining the size of the sampled subset with `rnorm(n=100`.

```{r,eval=F}
randtruncnormal_sim_10000 = rnorm(n=10000, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2])
par(mfrow=c(3,1))
plot(randtruncnormal_sim)
hist(randtruncnormal_sim)
hist(randtruncnormal_sim, freq=F)
curve(dnorm(x, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2]), from=150, to=250, add=T, col="red")

par(mfrow=c(4,2))
randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10 = replicate(n=10000, rnorm(n=10, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2]))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10, MARGIN=2, FUN=sd))
sd(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))

randtruncnormal_sim_10000_100 = replicate(n=10000, rnorm(n=100, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2]))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_100, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_100, MARGIN=2, FUN=sd))
sd(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_100, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))

randtruncnormal_sim_10000_1000 = replicate(n=10000, rnorm(n=1000, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2]))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_1000, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_1000, MARGIN=2, FUN=sd))
sd(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_1000, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))

randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10000 = replicate(n=10000, rnorm(n=10000, mean=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[1], sd=data$`AG Tree (tC/ha)`[2]))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10000, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))
hist(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10000, MARGIN=2, FUN=sd))
sd(apply(X = randtruncnormal_sim_10000_10000, MARGIN=2, FUN=mean))

```
